snippet: A proposed financial rescue package for Greece calls for debt payments as the first priority, whatever happens to Greece itself.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column on European bailout of Greece as a new austerity package is agreed to; says that if Greece does not meet its deficit reduction targets, Europe could be in a position to force the nation to fend for itself, reinforcing the fact that Greece is a small country of little importance to the rest of Europe; holds Greece may not be rescued in the end, but the rest of the euro zone will have been preserved.
lead_paragraph: A proposed financial rescue package for Greece calls for debt payments as the first priority, whatever happens to Greece itself.

headline.print_headline: Banks Come First in a Greek Rescue Plan
headline.seo: Plan for a Greek Debt Bailout Puts the Banks First
headline.main: Banks Come First in a Greek Rescue Plan
